result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert L Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to the sentence on 2016CF108.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Domestic Abuse Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert L Garcia

records.addlTxt: - Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Convictions have been returned.  Return to sender.  Insufficient Address.  Unable to Forward.
Settlement Form (PTC)

3:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2016CF108 with probation and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in and will plea to count 1 in 2016CM143 with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant Guilty as charged in 2016CM143.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2016CF108 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF108 / 2016CM143 (EACH CASE)

90 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to each other, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation. 
-2016CF108-AODA
-2016CM143-Domestic Abuse Assessment.
-DNA sample.

Court adjourned at 3:26 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

3:35 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - have come to an agreement and need to prepare the paperwork.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on June 13, 2017 at 3:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 3:36 p.m.
Status hearing on May 2, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:56 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - held a pretrial and kinda have a resolution.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 2, 2017 at 3:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:57 p.m.
Status hearing on March 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - have received the Discovery on the felony case and need to go over with the defendant and request another status on both cases.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 14, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:34 a.m.
Status hearing on January 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.

11:18 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - defendant will waive the prelim on the felony case.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Wilsnack and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Wilsnack enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 10, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:21 a.m.
State's

1:45 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - was recently appointed on 2016CF108 and requests a pretrial conference with the DA.  Court sets for Status of Prelim on December 13, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.. 

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.
Status hearing on November 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

11:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - defendant has a new case . Court sets both cases for Status Hearing on November 8, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:20 a.m.
Defendant came in person and address was confirmed, copy of NOH 10/11/16 given to party, and instructed to contact DA office as to possible mail issues-sr
Notice of hearing for Status Hearing scheduled on 10/11/2016 at 11:00 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Defendant's
By Atty Jon Wilsnack
Status hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on September 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

10:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney and will start with the Public Defender.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Court sets for Status Hearing on September 19, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:49 a.m.
Status hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:45 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  Statement by the defendant, has applied to the PD's office and has not been denied.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:47 a.m.
No Violent Contact with Natalia G.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
No Violent Contact with Natalia G.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant is not eligible for PD representation.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Natalia G.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
